original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close up, holiday slump persists
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Thursday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.20 percent, or 21.40 points, at 10,626.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.17 percent, or 5.23 points, at 3,054.
Top contributors to the ASPI were Commercial Bank of Ceylon Plc (up at 94.30), Central Finance Company Plc (up at 105.00), and Hatton National Bank Plc (up at 166.50).
Market participants said investor interest remained low amidst the holidays. (Colombo/Dec27/2023).
